meanings.definition: To preserve a dead body from decay by treating it with preservatives.
meanings.sent1: The funeral director embalmed the body to keep it from decaying.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to embalm their loved one to ensure the body stayed preserved.
meanings.sent3: After the embalming process, the body looked like a peaceful sleeping figure.
meanings.sent4: The embalmed body lay still, as if frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of the embalming fluid filled the room during the process.

meanings.definition: To treat a dead body with preservatives in order to prevent decay.
meanings.sent1: The mortician carefully embalmed the deceased to maintain their appearance.
meanings.sent2: Families often choose to embalm their loved ones for open-casket funerals.
meanings.sent3: The embalmed body seemed almost lifelike, fooling some into thinking the person was just sleeping.
meanings.sent4: The embalmed corpse looked peaceful, as if ready for eternal rest.
meanings.sent5: The process of embalming is a delicate art that requires precision and care.

meanings.definition: Preserved from decay by treating with preservatives.
meanings.sent1: The embalmed body was on display at the wake, looking serene and peaceful.
meanings.sent2: The embalmed remains were a stark contrast to the natural decay of the earth.
meanings.sent3: The embalmed corpse appeared almost lifelike, as if frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: The embalmed body seemed to defy the passage of time, remaining pristine.
meanings.sent5: The embalmed body was a testament to the skill of the mortician in preserving its appearance.
